answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links that you may find useful.
This article from American City & County magazine discusses examples of successful,local hydropower programs.
http://icma.org/en/Article/101257/Hydropower_Generates_a_Buzz_in_Public_Water_Systems
Community Hydro is a group from Vermont working towards promoting small hydro power resources in their area. The site has a lot of good information.
http://www.communityhydro.biz/about.html
The state of Oregon has a page dedicated to hydro power and cost effective ways to use it. http://www.oregon.gov/ENERGY/RENEW/Hydro/Hydro_index.shtml#Advisors
Montana has a similar page that you can view below.
http://www.montanagreenpower.com/other/hydro_success.php
I also included an article from the US Department of Energy about small hydro power and its benefits.
http://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy01osti/29065.pdf
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text: I'm finding a large amount of information/best practices on solar and wind energy uses. I'm interested in seeing how organizations have used hydro power to improve efficiency. Please let me know some best practices.
title: Hydro Power
